relations.target: law enforcement=01130458-n (ensuring obedience to the laws)
police officer=10468557-n (a member of a police force; \""it was an accident, officer\""

intimidation=01224966-n (the act of intimidating a weaker person to make them do something);07268725-n (a communication that makes you afraid to try something);07538999-n (the feeling of being intimidated; being made to feel afraid or timid);07558269-n (the feeling of discouragement in the face of someone's superior fame or wealth or status etc.)

psychological=01785621-a (mental or emotional as opposed to physical in nature; \""give psychological support\""; \""psychological warfare\"");02917107-a (of or relating to or determined by psychology; \""psychological theories\""

physical=00629845-a (having substance or material existence; perceptible to the senses; \""a physical manifestation\""; \""surrounded by tangible objects\"");00630045-a (concerned with material things; \""physical properties\""; \""the physical characteristics of the earth\""; \""the physical size of a computer\"");00845863-a (impelled by physical force especially against resistance; \""forcible entry\""; \""a real cop would get physical\""; \""strong-arm tactics\"");00877400-a (characterized by energetic bodily activity; \""a very physical dance performance\"");01578652-a (according with material things or natural laws (other than those peculiar to living matter); \""a reflex response to physical stimuli\"");01782757-a (involving the body as distinguished from the mind or spirit; \""physical exercise\""; \""physical suffering\""; \""was sloppy about everything but her physical appearance\"");02790581-a (relating to the sciences dealing with matter and energy; especially physics; \""physical sciences\""; \""physical laws\""

force=00130563-n (a putout of a base runner who is required to run; the putout is accomplished by holding the ball while touching the base to which the runner must advance before the runner reaches that base; \""the shortstop got the runner at second on a force\"");00967515-n (an act of aggression (as one against a person who resists); \""he may accomplish by craft in the long run what he cannot do by force and violence in the short one\"");04816894-n ((of a law) having legal validity; \""the law is still in effect\"");05042508-n (physical energy or intensity; \""he hit with all the force he could muster\""; \""it was destroyed by the strength of the gale\""; \""a government has not the vitality and forcefulness of a living man\"");05201846-n (a powerful effect or influence; \""the force of his eloquence easily persuaded them\"");08215338-n (a unit that is part of some military service; \""he sent Caesar a force of six thousand men\"");08224784-n (a group of people having the power of effective action; \""he joined forces with a band of adventurers\"");08224937-n (group of people willing to obey orders; \""a public force is necessary to give security to the rights of citizens\"");10480990-n (one possessing or exercising power or influence or authority; \""the mysterious presence of an evil power\""; \""may the force be with you\""; \""the forces of evil\"");11479041-n ((physics) the influence that produces a change in a physical quantity; \""force equals mass times acceleration\"");00749422-v (impose urgently, importunately, or inexorably; \""She forced her diet fads on him\"");01353131-v (do forcibly; exert force; \""Don't force it!\"");01519166-v (force into or from an action or state, either physically or metaphorically; \""She rammed her mind into focus\""; \""He drives me mad\"");01530059-v (squeeze like a wedge into a tight space; \""I squeezed myself into the corner\"");01589521-v (take by force; \""Storm the fort\"");01653967-v (urge or force (a person) to an action; constrain or motivate);01875972-v (move with force; \""He pushed the table into a corner\"");02510211-v (to cause to do through pressure or necessity, by physical, moral or intellectual means; \""She forced him to take a job in the city\""; \""He squeezed her for information\""
unjustified=01951967-a (lacking justification or authorization; \""desire for undue private profit\""; \""unwarranted limitations of personal freedom\""

excessive=01538069-a (beyond normal limits; \""excessive charges\""; \""a book of inordinate length\""; \""his dress stops just short of undue elegance\""; \""unreasonable demands\"");02008064-a (unrestrained, especially with regard to feelings; \""extravagant praise\""; \""exuberant compliments\""; \""overweening ambition\""; \""overweening greed\""

senses.definition: The use of excessive, unjustified force (typically of a physical nature, but also including verbal abuse and psychological intimidation) by a police officer while carrying out law enforcement duties
